oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A Practical Approach to Drug Dosage for the Practitioner: Introduction to the Use of Pharmacokinetics
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Mercer, H. Dwight
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: pharmacokinetics
drug dosage
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This presentation is intended to depart from the process involved in developing pharmacokinetic data and focus upon the potential application. There are five (5) areas in which the application of pharmacokinetics can be of benefit to the practitioner. These are:A- Individualized dosage regimensB-Estimating dosages for drugs.not approved in various food animals C- Economic assessment of multiple drug choicesO- Critical tissue distribution estimatesE - Estimating or projecting drug withdrawal times.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1984; 33-38
